0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Cough: sustained-release, 1 tablet (1000 mg guaifenesin, 150 mg potassium guaiacolsulfonate) ORALLY every 12 h

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy in children under 6 y of age have not been established
  • Cough: (6 to 12 y) sustained-release, 1/2 tablet (500 mg guaifenesin, 75 mg potassium guaiacolsulfonate) ORALLY every 12 h
  • Cough: (12 y and older) sustained-release, 1 tablet (1000 mg guaifenesin, 150 mg potassium guaiacolsulfonate) ORALLY every 12 h

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to guaifenesin or potassium guaiacolsulfonate

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• underlying cause of cough should be determined prior to initiating therapy
  • increased risk of drug-induced kidney stone formation (guaifenesin)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• Guaifenesin: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.
  • Potassium Guaiacolsulfonate: Unknown

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
(sustained-release tablet) do not crush or chew

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
Humibid LA
Oral Tablet, Extended Release: (Guaifenesin - Potassium Guaiacolsulfonate) 600 MG-300 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause nausea or vomiting.
  • Patients should report signs/symptoms of nephrolithiasis, especially if ingesting large quantities. Do not take more than prescribed.
